segment.source: Install Windows 10 using a previous version of Windows PE
segment.target: Install Windows 10 using a previous version of Windows PE

segment.source: Install Windows 10 using a previous version of Windows PE
segment.target: Install Windows 10 using a previous version of Windows PE

segment.source: Install Windows 10 using a previous version of Windows PE
segment.target: Install Windows 10 using a previous version of Windows PE

segment.source: To install some features of Windows 10, such as Compact OS, you'll need the Windows 10 version of DISM.
segment.target: To install some features of Windows 10, such as Compact OS, you'll need the Windows 10 version of DISM.

segment.source: You can include the latest version DISM in your Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) image, or run it from a separate location, such as on a removable drive.
segment.target: You can include the latest version DISM in your Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) image, or run it from a separate location, such as on a removable drive.

segment.source: If you include it with WinPE, it will add roughly 4MB to the size of your DISM image.
segment.target: If you include it with WinPE, it will add roughly 4MB to the size of your DISM image.

segment.source: You'll need to install and configure the drivers needed for DISM, including the wimmount.sys and wofadk.sys drivers, each time you boot WinPE.
segment.target: You'll need to install and configure the drivers needed for DISM, including the wimmount.sys and wofadk.sys drivers, each time you boot WinPE.

segment.source: To add DISM into your Windows PE image
segment.target: To add DISM into your Windows PE image

segment.source: On your technician PC, install the Windows ADK for Windows 10.
segment.target: On your technician PC, install the Windows ADK for Windows 10.

segment.source: Mount WinPE.
segment.target: Mount WinPE.

segment.source: For WinPE 3.x, mount the file: sourceswinpe.wim.
segment.target: For WinPE 3.x, mount the file: sourceswinpe.wim.

segment.source: For WinPE 4.x and 5.x, mount the file: sourcesboot.wim.
segment.target: For WinPE 4.x and 5.x, mount the file: sourcesboot.wim.

segment.source: Copy the DISM folder from the Windows ADK into a new folder in the mounted WinPE image.
segment.target: Copy the DISM folder from the Windows ADK into a new folder in the mounted WinPE image.

segment.source: Important Don't overwrite the existing DISM files from the system32 folder in the WinPE image.
segment.target: Important Don't overwrite the existing DISM files from the system32 folder in the WinPE image.

segment.source: Instead, create a new folder on the host computer to copy the Windows ADK files into.
segment.target: Instead, create a new folder on the host computer to copy the Windows ADK files into.

segment.source: Unmount WinPE.
segment.target: Unmount WinPE.

segment.source: Create WinPE bootable media, or replace the WinPE image file on your existing removable media.
segment.target: Create WinPE bootable media, or replace the WinPE image file on your existing removable media.

segment.source: Install and use DISM from WinPE
segment.target: Install and use DISM from WinPE

segment.source: Boot your destination device to WinPE.
segment.target: Boot your destination device to WinPE.

segment.source: Install and configure DISM's required drivers by using either WimMountAdkSetupAmd64.exe /Install or WimMountAdkSetupX86.exe /Install.
segment.target: Install and configure DISM's required drivers by using either WimMountAdkSetupAmd64.exe /Install or WimMountAdkSetupX86.exe /Install.

segment.source: For the default (RAMDisk) version of WinPE, you'll need to run this command each time you boot WinPE.
segment.target: For the default (RAMDisk) version of WinPE, you'll need to run this command each time you boot WinPE.

segment.source: To learn how to run this command automatically when WinPE boots, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.
segment.target: To learn how to run this command automatically when WinPE boots, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.

segment.source: Verify that the Windows 10 version of DISM is installed.
segment.target: Verify that the Windows 10 version of DISM is installed.

segment.source: The output shows the build number, for example:
segment.target: The output shows the build number, for example:

segment.source: Run DISM commands from the new folder.
segment.target: Run DISM commands from the new folder.
